intro: Meehania henryi, commonly known as the Henry's meehania, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
